title.title: The Correspondence of John Hunt and Joshua Evans

msIdentifier.institution: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

projectDesc.p: The correspondence of Quaker ministers John Hunt and Joshua Evans are stored at the Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College. With the generous support of H. David and Joyce E. Hunt, Library staff scanned and transcribed these letters in 2023 and encoded the text in TEI. The 2023 project also included researching individuals mentioned in the text to create and update records about them in the Social Networks and Archival Context website

body.p:
My kind love is to thee and thine although an entire stranger as to the outward but having an agreeable acquaintance with thy beloved husband who in and has been this some weeks in these parts, has often drawn my mind in near sympathy towards thee with desires that those may be kept and preserved in the patience now in the time of his being called from thee as at other times. I may inform thee that his labors of love in these parts has been & I believe to the ease of his own mind, and much to the satisfaction of friends and others hereaway. Notwithstanding his singularity he is dearly beloved amongst us and I firmly believe his service has lessened thereby. With desires that when his service is over he may be favored to return to his family and friends with with the leeward of peace and as thou art favored to give him up freely thou will be a partaker of that ineffable peace that the world can
give nor take away which is great encouragement to give up to the Lordâ€™s requirings as he takes great delight in a freewill offering which I desire may be the happy situation of each of our minds

closer.salute: and am with affectionate love to thee and thine thy assured wellwishing friend
